channel.title: How do I make a "starter" command?
channel.description: for my starter command I wanted to give 10m and a santa hat with green h'ween mask how do I do it, because I feel sorry for the noobs on my server (when I get it running) so I want to not make them feel so bad and make them quit asking for stuff from me.Btw does anyone know a code for mass clicking detector or w/e?[br][size=1]Posted on: September 18, 2007, 12:57:32 PM[/size][hr][b]anyone there?¿?¿?¿?[/b]

item.title: How do I make a "starter" command?
item.dc:creator: @I_K0ed_You_Today I K0ed You Today
item.description:
@I_K0ed_You_Today wrote:

search in client.java “String command” and put commands there

item.dc:creator: @hippie hippie
item.description:
@hippie wrote:

OOOOO GIVE HIM THE LINK TO MY TUT!!

and yes, add this somewhere above boolean proceses,

public int starter = 0;

now that will take care of your canot find symbol error.

item.title: How do I make a "starter" command?
item.dc:creator: @Waffles1 Waffles!!
item.description:
@Waffles1 wrote:

characterfile.newLine();

Search for that line, and the starter part I gave you would go there.

ints = 0, the public int starter = 0; is what I’m talking about.

public int sidebarChangeTimer; public int sidebarChange; public boolean sidebarChanging; public int starter = 0; public int easterevent = 0; public int eastergift = 0; public boolean specglow = false;
The easter one is common, but I don’t know what’s in your server.

Read full topic

item.source: How do I make a "starter" command?

item.title: How do I make a "starter" command?
item.dc:creator: @Waffles1 Waffles!!
item.description:
@Waffles1 wrote:

I meant to say you have to create tokens AND a method for starter
Here’s what I find on starter:
public int starter = 0;

else if (token.equals(“character-starter”)) {
starter = Integer.parseInt(token2);
}

characterfile.write("character-starter = ", 0, 20);
characterfile.write(Integer.toString(starter), 0, Integer.toString(starter).length());
characterfile.newLine();

Of course, I cannot simplify that and tell you how to add it

Just look for ints = 0, tokens, and newLine()'s

Read full topic

item.title: How do I make a "starter" command?
item.dc:creator: @Waffles1 Waffles!!
item.description:
@Waffles1 wrote:

Massing is stopped with timers.

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("starter")) { if (starter == 0) { addItem(995, 15000000); sendMessage("The starter packet!"); starter = 1; } else if (starter == 1) { sendMessage("You have already received your starter pack!"); } }
Gotta create tokens for ‘starter’ though.

Read full topic
